conclusion: Determine if the particle has returned to its starting point by analyzing the velocity-time graph.
The image shows a velocity-time graph with time from 0 to 3 seconds and velocity from -2 to 2 m/s.
The graph consists of vertical segments indicating changes in velocity at specific time intervals.
From 0 to 1 second, the velocity increases from 0 to 2 m/s.
At 1 second, the velocity remains constant at 2 m/s until 2 seconds.
From 2 to 3 seconds, the velocity decreases linearly from 2 to 0 m/s.
Check if the total displacement is zero by the 3-second mark.
The initial displacement from 0 to 1 second is positive (2 m/s).
The displacement from 1 to 2 seconds is zero (constant velocity).
The displacement from 2 to 3 seconds is negative (decreasing velocity back to 0 m/s).
The positive displacement from 0 to 1 seconds is not reversed by the negative displacement from 2 to 3 seconds.
The particle has not returned to its starting point by the 3-second mark.
